paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses a case of a 19-year-old female with a variant of unknown significance in the KCNH2 gene, associated with long QT syndrome type 2.

patients.phenotype: Prolonged QTc leading to Torsades de Pointes and cardiac arrest

individual_records.phenotype_details: Documented prolonged QTc leading to Torsades de Pointes and cardiac arrest.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient underwent genetic testing for long QT syndromes, which revealed a variant of unknown significance in KCNH2 (exon 10 c.2407_2409del (p.Asp803del)).

functional_data.summary: The specific variant seen in this patient has yet to be reported as associated with risk for LQTS.

variants.segregation_data: The variant has not been reported to segregate with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is classified as of unknown significance and has not been previously associated with risk for long QT syndrome.
key_quotes: Gene KCNH2 (also known as hERG) has been implicated in LQTS2; however, the specific variant seen in this patient has yet to be reported as associated with risk for LQTS.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information regarding the KCNH2 variant.
